alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry; Putnam; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:39AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of east central Rock Island, Bureau, northern Henry and Putnam Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 639 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms producing heavy rain along a line extending from near Osborn to near Ladd. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on area roadways, and low lying areas will result in impacts to travel. Locations impacted include... East Moline, Kewanee, Princeton, Hennepin, Geneseo, Spring Valley, Colona, Le Claire, DePue, Port Byron, Granville, Walnut, Ladd, Wyanet, Atkinson, Rapids City, Sheffield, Annawan, Tiskilwa and La Moille. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 72. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 11 and 19. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 180 between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed. Be sure to not drive through flooded roadways. Report any water issues to local law enforecement.
